title: Determining PON1 Activity Using Phenyl Acetate Substrate
description: Procedure for determining PON1 activity in plasma or serum using a UV-transparent 96-well microplate and phenyl acetate substrate with kinetic measurements at 270 nm.

checklist.text: Place the 96 Well Plate on the bench.

properties.text: Lock AR objects to maintain positions during the experiment.

checklist.text: Collect blood in appropriate tubes ensuring sufficient volume for analysis. Follow biohazard handling and wear PPE.

properties.text: Dispose of materials according to biohazard protocols.

checklist.text: Centrifuge at 2,000 x g for 10 minutes at 4°C to separate plasma/serum.

properties.text: Use a refrigerated centrifuge set to 4°C for proper separation.

checklist.text: Transfer plasma/serum to 0.5 mL tubes using a Pasteur pipette; aliquot to minimize freeze-thaw cycles.

properties.text: Avoid disturbing the cell layer and use wide-orifice pipette tips.

checklist.text: Invert tubes to mix, then centrifuge at 10,000 x g for 5 minutes at 4°C to remove particulates.

properties.text: Ensure clarity of sample for accurate readings.

checklist.text: Dilute each plasma/serum sample by mixing 7 µL with 63 µL of dilution buffer (1:10 dilution).

properties.text: Use calibrated pipettes and avoid volume errors.

checklist.text: Transfer 20 µL of diluted plasma/serum sample 1 into wells A1, A2, and A3.

properties.text: Ensure use of UV-transparent 96-well microplate validated for 270 nm measurements.

checklist.text: Transfer 20 µL of diluted plasma/serum sample 2 into wells B1, B2, and B3.

properties.text: Use a clean pipette tip to avoid cross-contamination.

checklist.text: Transfer 20 µL of dilution buffer into well C1 as blank control.

properties.text: Assign the blank control to well C1 for baseline measurements.

checklist.text: Prepare working substrate by adding 25 µL phenyl acetate to 25 mL assay buffer in a tube (6.52 mM).

properties.text: Work in a fume hood and wear PPE due to phenyl acetate hazards.

checklist.text: Cap the tube and mix vigorously for 1 minute.

properties.text: Ensure complete emulsification; discard after 1 hour.

checklist.text: Add 180 µL of the working assay solution to each well containing sample or blank.

properties.text: Pipet carefully to reduce variability.

checklist.text: Transfer the plate to the calibrated UV/visible spectrophotometer at 25°C and verify equipment calibration.

properties.text: Calibration ensures accuracy of Beer–Lambert conversion.

checklist.text: Mix the plate for 5 seconds before readings using the spectrophotometer's program.

properties.text: Mixing ensures even substrate distribution.

checklist.text: Monitor phenyl acetate hydrolysis at 270 nm every 15 seconds for 4 minutes.

properties.text: Use only the linear portion of the reaction curve for calculations.

checklist.text: Measure the light pathlength in each well using the spectrophotometer software.

properties.text: Pathlength correction normalizes absorbance values.

checklist.text: Divide initial activity rates by the light pathlength, then apply Beer–Lambert law to report PON1 activity in U/mL or µmol/min/mL.

properties.text: Document calibration constants for consistency.

checklist.text: Calculate average and standard deviation of triplicate readings for each sample. Repeat assay if deviation ≥ 10 mOD/min.

properties.text: Accurate statistics ensure reliable activity determination.

checklist.text: Check blank absorbance readings; elevated values suggest contamination. If so, prepare fresh buffers and repeat.

properties.text: Verify pipetting accuracy to avoid false readings.

checklist.text: Process diluted samples immediately to prevent PON1 degradation. Store plasma/serum at –80°C and use promptly after dilution.

properties.text: Proper storage and immediate processing are critical.

checklist.text: Dispose of phenyl acetate waste and biohazardous blood samples safely according to guidelines.

properties.text: Follow institutional hazardous waste disposal procedures.
